section.name: Quickstart guide
section.p: The quickest way to get started is to obtain one of the pre-built packages. Even when adding additional functionalities to Hippo ECM, you normally don't need to rebuild Hippo ECM. This because more functionality can be added by simply adding the JARs containing the add-ons to the already packaged product, or uploading them into the running packaged product. Therefore, there is no need to do a rebuild from all the sources, one of the pre-built packages can always be customized.

The quickstart packages contain all the core packaged products, but have been pre-configured with a number of modules and settings, to give you a quick overview of the product without having the laborious tasks to first enter content, create users, etcetera.

Hippo ECM is a web-based application, and therefor is intended to run inside a servlet or application container. These containers accept pre-built applications in the form of a WAR or EAR archive package, and provide basic functions to Hippo ECM and management of your application.
To get you started quickly, first determine the application container platform you wish to use to run Hippo ECM. Then;

subsection.name: Download
subsection.p: Download either the WAR or EAR package. For deployment in Tomcat or Jetty, use the WAR package. The EARs need less configuration and can grow with your needs, but require an application container to run in.

subsection.name: Deploy, run and access
subsection.p: Below you find how to deploy the application in Tomcat, GlassFish or other application contains. Once the application has been deployed and started, you can access the Hippo CMS under the URL:

The port number may change if you configured you application or servlet container to run with a different port. When deploy the application on a machine other than your local machine you need to change "localhost" to the correct machine name.

ol.li: Download Tomcat 6.0 from the Apache Tomcat website
Copy the WAR from the link above to apache-tomcat-6.0.16\webapps\cms.war

subsection.name: Deploying in Glassfish or other application servers
subsection.p: Once your have obtained the sample EAR and have started and configured your application server, you can proceed with deploying the EAR in the application server. This procedure depends on the application server. Hippo ECM does not require any special application dependent deployment procedure, nor does it dictate which application server environment is required. As example we provide the procedure for GlassFish. Although the procedure is similar for other application servers, it does differ, so check the documentation of your application server.
Go to the administration console of your GlassFish installation, once glassfish is running by accessing the following URL in your browser on the machine that runs the GlassFish instance:
Login using the username and password of the administrator you had selected during installation (default username is admin and default password is adminadmin.
Select in the left pane "Enterprise applications"
Then in the main pane select the button "Deploy"

When the page has loaded make sure the "Packaged file to be uploaded to the server" is checked and use the browse button to select the build or downloaded EAR file of Hippo ECM. Then just choose "Ok" to perform the deployment.
Once the server has finished, the application is now available on your server on the configured hostname and portname, which is by default:
Note that the deployed location does not end with /cms
